From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: ċelebrar

Aragonese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin celebrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /θeleˈbɾa(ɾ)/
  • IPA(key): /seleˈbɾa(ɾ)/ (Benasquese)
  • Syllabification: ce‧le‧brar
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

celebrar

  1. (transitive) to celebrate, to observe (to honour by rites, by ceremonies of joy and respect, or by refraining from ordinary business)
  2. (transitive) to celebrate (to perform or participate in, as a sacrament or solemn rite)
  3. (transitive) to celebrate (to extol or honour in a solemn manner)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of celebrar (first conjugation)
infinitive celebrar
gerund celebrando
past participle masculine feminine
singular celebrau, celebrato celebrada, celebrata
plural celebraus, celebratos celebradas, celebratas
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative yo tú él nusatros
nusatras 		vusatros
vusatras 		ellos/els
ellas
present celebro celebras celebra celebramos celebraz celebran
imperfect celebraba, celebrabe celebrabas celebraba celebrabanos celebrabaz celebraban
preterite celebré celebrés celebró celebremos celebrez celebroron, celebrón
future celebraré celebrarás celebrará celebraremos celebrarez celebrarán
conditional celebraría celebrarías celebraría celebraríanos celebraríaz celebrarían
subjunctive yo tú él nusatros
nusatras 		vusatros
vusatras 		ellos/els
ellas
present celebre celebres celebre celebremos celebrez celebren
imperfect celebrase celebrases celebrase celebrasenos celebrasez celebrasen
imperative — tú — — vusatros
vusatras 		—
— celebra — — celebraz —

Derived terms

[edit]
  • celebrando

Related terms

[edit]
  • celebración
  • celebrador
  • celebre
  • celebridat

References

[edit]
  • “celebrar”, in Aragonario, diccionario castellano–aragonés (in Spanish)
  • Bal Palazios, Santiago (2002), “celebrar”, in Dizionario breu de a luenga aragonesa, Zaragoza, →ISBN

Asturian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /θeleˈbɾaɾ/ [θe.leˈβ̞ɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ce‧le‧brar

Verb

[edit]

celebrar (first-person singular indicative present celebro, past participle celebráu)

  1. to celebrate

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of celebrar
infinitive celebrar
gerund celebrando
past participle m celebráu, f celebrada, n celebrao, m pl celebraos, f pl celebraes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present celebro celebres celebra celebramos celebráis celebren
imperfect celebraba celebrabes celebraba celebrábemos, celebrábamos celebrabeis, celebrabais celebraben
preterite celebré celebrasti, celebresti celebró celebremos celebrastis, celebrestis celebraron
pluperfect celebrare, celebrara celebrares, celebraras celebrare, celebrara celebráremos, celebráramos celebrareis, celebrarais celebraren, celebraran
future celebraré celebrarás celebrará celebraremos celebraréis celebrarán
conditional celebraría celebraríes celebraría celebraríemos, celebraríamos celebraríeis, celebraríais celebraríen
subjunctive present celebre celebres, celebras celebre celebremos celebréis celebren, celebran
imperfect celebrare, celebrara celebrares, celebraras celebrare, celebrara celebráremos, celebráramos celebrareis, celebrarais celebraren, celebraran
imperative — celebra — — celebrái —

Related terms

[edit]
  • celebración

Further reading

[edit]
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “celebrar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN
  • “celebrar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin celebrāre. First attested in the 14th century.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [sə.ləˈβɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [sə.ləˈbɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [se.leˈbɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)

Verb

[edit]

celebrar (first-person singular present celebro, first-person singular preterite celebrí, past participle celebrat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /e/

  1. (transitive) to celebrate, to observe (to honour by rites, by ceremonies of joy and respect, or by refraining from ordinary business)
  2. (transitive) to celebrate (to perform or participate in, as a sacrament or solemn rite)
  3. (transitive) to celebrate (to extol or honour in a solemn manner)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of celebrar (first conjugation)
infinitive celebrar
gerund celebrant
past participle masculine feminine
singular celebrat celebrada
plural celebrats celebrades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present celebro celebres celebra celebrem celebreu celebren
imperfect celebrava celebraves celebrava celebràvem celebràveu celebraven
future celebraré celebraràs celebrarà celebrarem celebrareu celebraran
preterite celebrí celebrares celebrà celebràrem celebràreu celebraren
conditional celebraria celebraries celebraria celebraríem celebraríeu celebrarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present celebri celebris celebri celebrem celebreu celebrin
imperfect celebrés celebressis celebrés celebréssim celebréssiu celebressin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — celebra celebri celebrem celebreu celebrin
negative (no) — no celebris no celebri no celebrem no celebreu no celebrin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • celebrant

Related terms

[edit]
  • celebració
  • celebrador
  • cèlebre
  • celebritat

References

[edit]
  1. ^ “celebrar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025

Further reading

[edit]
  • “celebrar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “celebrar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “celebrar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin celebrō.

Verb

[edit]

celebrar (first-person singular present celebro, first-person singular preterite celebrei, past participle celebrado)

  1. to celebrate

Conjugation

[edit]

(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person

Interlingua

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

celebrar

  1. to celebrate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of celebrar
infinitive celebrar
participle present perfect
celebrante celebrate
active simple perfect
present celebra ha celebrate
past celebrava habeva celebrate
future celebrara habera celebrate
conditional celebrarea haberea celebrate
imperative celebra —
passive simple perfect
present es celebrate ha essite celebrate
past esseva celebrate habeva essite celebrate
future essera celebrate habera essite celebrate
conditional esserea celebrate haberea essite celebrate
imperative sia celebrate —

[edit]

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin celebrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /se.leˈbɾa(ʁ)/ [se.leˈbɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /se.leˈbɾa(ʁ)/ [se.leˈbɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /se.leˈbɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /se.leˈbɾa(ʁ)/ [se.leˈbɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /se.leˈbɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /sɨ.lɨˈbɾaɾ/ [sɨ.lɨˈβɾaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /sɨ.lɨˈbɾaɾ/ [sɨ.lɨˈβɾaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /sɨ.lɨˈbɾa.ɾi/ [sɨ.lɨˈβɾa.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: ce‧le‧brar

Verb

[edit]

celebrar (first-person singular present celebro, first-person singular preterite celebrei, past participle celebrado)

  1. to celebrate (all senses)
    Synonym: festejar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of celebrar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal celebrar
Personal celebrar celebrares celebrar celebrarmos celebrardes celebrarem
Gerund
celebrando
Past participle
Masculine celebrado celebrados
Feminine celebrada celebradas
Indicative
Present celebro celebras celebra celebramos celebrais celebram
Imperfect celebrava celebravas celebrava celebrávamos celebráveis celebravam
Preterite celebrei celebraste celebrou celebramos1, celebrámos2 celebrastes celebraram
Pluperfect celebrara celebraras celebrara celebráramos celebráreis celebraram
Future celebrarei celebrarás celebrará celebraremos celebrareis celebrarão
Conditional celebraria celebrarias celebraria celebraríamos celebraríeis celebrariam
Subjunctive
Present celebre celebres celebre celebremos celebreis celebrem
Imperfect celebrasse celebrasses celebrasse celebrássemos celebrásseis celebrassem
Future celebrar celebrares celebrar celebrarmos celebrardes celebrarem
Imperative
Affirmative celebra celebre celebremos celebrai celebrem
Negative (não) não celebres não celebre não celebremos não celebreis não celebrem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Further reading

[edit]
  • “celebrar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “celebrar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “celebrar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “celebrar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “celebrar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “celebrar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin celebrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /θeleˈbɾaɾ/ [θe.leˈβ̞ɾaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /seleˈbɾaɾ/ [se.leˈβ̞ɾaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ce‧le‧brar

Verb

[edit]

celebrar (first-person singular present celebro, first-person singular preterite celebré, past participle celebrado)

  1. to celebrate
  2. to hold, to organize (a formal event, conference, meeting etc.)
    • 2020 April 12, “Sánchez defiende su gestión ante un nuevo alud de quejas y críticas de presidentes autonómicos”, in La Vanguardia‎[2]:
      El presidente del Gobierno, Pedro Sánchez, ha vuelto a defender su gestión de la crisis del coronavirus en la conferencia de presidentes autonómicos que, por quinto domingo consecutivo, está celebrando esta mañana.
      The Prime Minister, Pedro Sánchez, has once again defended his management of the coronavirus crisis at the conference of regional presidents which is being held this morning for the fifth Sunday in a row.
  3. to welcome, to accept

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
